playerItems.h1: Digital Registration of Births and Deaths on Centre's Portal to Begin on October 1

playerItems.p: Starting from October 1, all reported births and deaths in India will be digitally registered on the Centre's portal

playerItems.h1: Registration of Births and Deaths (Amendment) Act, 2023
playerItems.p: Introduces digital birth certificates that can be used for various purposes, including education, driving licenses, government jobs, passports, Aadhaar, voter enrollment, and marriage registration.
The new system streamlines the process by providing a single digital document for various official purposes.
The National Population Register (NPR) serves as a foundational step towards creating the National Register of Citizens (NRC), as per the Citizenship Act.
States are mandated to share birth and death data with the central government through the Civil Registration System (CRS) portal.
The Act emphasizes the use of Aadhaar numbers, which have a high saturation rate in India, for birth registration
